sections.title: Career Summary
sections.summary: I hold a Master’s degree in Geomatics with a focus on GIS, remote sensing, and environmental data analysis. My research examined forest cover change through the use of modern and declassified historical imagery. I have practical experience sailing in the Sea of Cortez, completed the RYA Day Skipper course in the Strait of Georgia. In addition, I have a B.A. in International Relations and maintain a strong interest in how geospatial analysis can inform international development and environmental efforts

items.degree: Master of Geomatics in Environmental Management (MGEM)
details: Developed skills in GIS, remote sensing, and spatial statistics through hands-on projects to support environmental management and decision-making

items.degree: B.A. International Relations, Minor in Russian

items.institution: Druga Gimnazija, Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina

items.title: Project: Applying Declassified Cold War Intelligence Imagery for Long-Term Forest Cover Change Analysis
details: Developed a hybrid remote sensing workflow to classify forest cover using declassified panchromatic Cold War and modern multispectral imagery in the Pamir Mountains, Tajikistan

Created  reproducible R, Google Earth Engine, and GIS workflows to apply segmentation, texture metrics, and supervised Random Forest classifiers to detect land cover types in challenging mixed terrain
Quantified forest cover change over 45 years, with implications for environmental monitoring and land use analysis in conflict-affected regions
Communicated results through visualizations, reports, and presentations for interdisciplinary audiences

items.title: Geospatial Analysis Intern
details: Analyzed imagery and geospatial data to produce intelligence reports
Conducted open-source research to contextualize analytical results
Developed recommendations for improvements in resource utilization based on organizational capabilities

items.title: Legal Assistant
details: Coordinated estate filed, maintained relationships with beneficiaries, and ensured accuracy in trust accounting using LEAP legal software
Drafted and reviewed contracts, agreements, and other legal documents for commercial transactions
Conducted legal research, filed annual reports, and maintained minute books for over 200 corporations

items.title: Host and Server
details: Managed reservations and guest flow using OpenTable
Processed transactions and orders through Squirrel POS system
Coordinated with kitchen and bar staff to ensure smooth restaurant operations and excellent service

items.title: Guest Experience Representative
details: Provided customer support via email, chat, and in person
Resolved inquiries related to ticketing, lessons, and resort information
Managed sensitive customer and sales data across multiple platforms

items.title: Jewish Outdoor Leadership Institute Guide
details: Led backpacking and backcountry trips for high school students
Developed and taught outdoor and Jewish education curricula focused on group dynamics and community building
Responded to medical, social, and emotional challenges effectively

items.title: Philanthropy Volunteer
details: Supported fundraising campaigns by integrating internal tools for data synchronization
Managed Van Dusen’s Adopt-A-Tree program by updating garden maps and donor records
Utilized Donor Perfect CRM software to track contributions and generate reports

items.title: Scholars in Prison Advocate & Conference Organizer
details: Led advocacy campaigns for imprisoned scholars
Coordinated an international academic freedom conference
Conducted media outreach, including a radio interview

items.title: Election Watch Team Member
details: Analyzed Sri Lanka’s political landscape for campaign developments
Designed graphics and social media posts for APF’s platforms
